org.commonvox.hbase_column_manager

Class RepositoryAdmin

  • Object
    • RepositoryAdmin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class RepositoryAdmin
extends Object
implements Closeable
    A RepositoryAdmin provides ColumnManager repository maintenance and query facilities, as well as schema metadata discovery, export, and import facilities; it is used as a complement to the standard Admin interface, with an Admin instance (provided by an MConnectionFactory-created Connection) being used in a standard manner to maintain Namespace, Table, and Column Family structures, and a RepositoryAdmin instance being used to maintain ColumnDefinition structures and to query ColumnAuditor structures.
    Author:
    Daniel Vimont

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RepositoryAdmin(Connection connection)
      Initialize a RepositoryAdmin object using an already-created Connection.

      HTableMultiplexer createHTableMultiplexer(int perRegionServerBufferQueueSize)
      Create an HTableMultiplexer object.

      SPECIAL NOTE: An HTableMultiplexer returned by this method will (1) validate submitted Column qualifiers and values (if ColumnDefinitionsEnforced is set to true for the related Column Family), (2) process "put" requests in a standard manner (queuing them for subsequent asynchronous processing by HBase) and then (3) perform synchronous ColumnManager repository processing upon the metadata of each successfully queued "put".
      void deleteColumnDefinition(HTableDescriptor htd, HColumnDescriptor hcd, byte[] colQualifier)
      Delete the ColumnDefinition pertaining to the submitted Column Qualifier from the submitted Table and Column Family.

      Delete the ColumnDefinition pertaining to the submitted Column Qualifier from the submitted Table and Column Family.
      void discoverSchema()
      Performs discovery of all ColumnManager-included user Tables and stores the schema metadata in the ColumnManager repository; includes discovery of ColumnAuditor schema metadata (performing full scan [with KeyOnlyFilter] of all Tables that are included in ColumnManager processing).
      void discoverSchema(TableName tableName)
      Performs discovery of the specified Table's schema metadata and stores it in the ColumnManager repository; includes discovery of ColumnAuditor schema metadata (performing full scan [with KeyOnlyFilter] of the Table).

      Creates an external HBaseSchemaArchive (HSA) file in XML format* containing the complete metadata contents (i.e., all Namespace, Table, Column Family, ColumnAuditor, and ColumnDefinition metadata) of the ColumnManager metadata repository.

      • columnDefinitionsEnforced

        public boolean columnDefinitionsEnforced(TableName tableName,
                                         byte[] colFamily)
                                  throws IOException
        Ascertains whether or not column definition enforcement is enabled for a specified Column Family.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Name of Table to which Column Family belongs.
        colFamily - Name of Column Family for which column definition enforcement is to be ascertained
        Returns:
        true if column definition enforcement is enabled for the specified Column Family; false if column definition enforcement is not enabled
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remote or network exception occurs

      • setColumnDefinitionsEnforced

        public void setColumnDefinitionsEnforced(boolean enabled,
                                         TableName tableName,
                                         byte[] colFamily)
                                  throws IOException
        Enable/disable column definition enforcement for the specified Column Family. When ColumnManager is activated and column definition enforcement is enabled for a Column Family of a Table that is included in ColumnManager processing, then any Column qualifier submitted in a Mutation to the Table and Column Family (via the HBase API) must correspond to an existing ColumnDefinition, and the corresponding Column value submitted must pass all validations (if any) stipulated by the ColumnDefinition.
        Parameters:
        enabled - if true, column definition enforcement is enabled; if false, it is disabled
        tableName - Name of Table to which Column Family belongs
        colFamily - Name of Column Family for which column definition enforcement is to be enabled or disabled
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remote or network exception occurs

      • getChangeEventMonitor

        public ChangeEventMonitor getChangeEventMonitor()
                                         throws IOException
        Get a ChangeEventMonitor object
        Returns:
        ChangeEventMonitor object
        Throws:

      • createHTableMultiplexer

        public HTableMultiplexer createHTableMultiplexer(int perRegionServerBufferQueueSize)
                                          throws IOException
        Create an HTableMultiplexer object.

        SPECIAL NOTE: An HTableMultiplexer returned by this method will (1) validate submitted Column qualifiers and values (if ColumnDefinitionsEnforced is set to true for the related Column Family), (2) process "put" requests in a standard manner (queuing them for subsequent asynchronous processing by HBase) and then (3) perform synchronous ColumnManager repository processing upon the metadata of each successfully queued "put". Be advised that the third step will not take into account any potentially failed "put" transactions among those queued in the second step; instead it assumes that all "put" transactions succeeded, updating the ColumnManager repository accordingly.
        Parameters:
        perRegionServerBufferQueueSize - determines the max number of the buffered Put ops for each region server before dropping a request.
        Returns:
        HTableMultiplexer object
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remote or network exception occurs

      • discoverSchema

        public void discoverSchema()
                    throws IOException
        Performs discovery of all ColumnManager-included user Tables and stores the schema metadata in the ColumnManager repository; includes discovery of ColumnAuditor schema metadata (performing full scan [with KeyOnlyFilter] of all Tables that are included in ColumnManager processing).
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remote or network exception occurs

      • discoverSchema

        public void discoverSchema(TableName tableName)
                    throws IOException
        Performs discovery of the specified Table's schema metadata and stores it in the ColumnManager repository; includes discovery of ColumnAuditor schema metadata (performing full scan [with KeyOnlyFilter] of the Table). Note that the specified Table must be included in ColumnManager processing; otherwise invocation of this method will have no effect.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Table for which schema metadata is to be discovered; submitted Table must be included in ColumnManager processing
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remote or network exception occurs

      • exportRepository

        public void exportRepository(File targetFile,
                             boolean formatted)
                      throws IOException,
                             JAXBException
        Creates an external HBaseSchemaArchive (HSA) file in XML format* containing the complete metadata contents (i.e., all Namespace, Table, Column Family, ColumnAuditor, and ColumnDefinition metadata) of the ColumnManager metadata repository. In effect, this is an XML-formatted serialization of objects of the following classes: NamespaceDescriptor, MTableDescriptor, MColumnDescriptor, ColumnAuditor, and ColumnDefinition.

        *An HSA file adheres to the XML Schema layout in HBaseSchemaArchive.xsd.xml.
        Parameters:
        targetFile - target file
        formatted - if true, insert whitespace (linefeeds and hierarchical indentations) between XML elements to produce human-readable XML.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remote or network exception occurs
        JAXBException - if an exception occurs in the context of JAXB processing

      • exportNamespaceSchema

        public void exportNamespaceSchema(String sourceNamespaceName,
                                  File targetFile,
                                  boolean formatted)
                           throws IOException,
                                  JAXBException
        Creates an external HBaseSchemaArchive (HSA) file in XML format* containing the complete schema contents (i.e., the Namespace, Table, Column Family, ColumnAuditor, and ColumnDefinition metadata) of the specified HBase Namespace. In effect, this is an XML-formatted serialization of objects of the following classes: NamespaceDescriptor, MTableDescriptor, MColumnDescriptor, ColumnAuditor, and ColumnDefinition.

        *An HSA file adheres to the XML Schema layout in HBaseSchemaArchive.xsd.xml.
        Parameters:
        sourceNamespaceName - namespace from which to export schema
        targetFile - target file
        formatted - if true, insert whitespace (linefeeds and hierarchical indentations) between XML elements to produce human-readable XML.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remote or network exception occurs
        JAXBException - if an exception occurs in the context of JAXB processing

      • exportTableSchema

        public void exportTableSchema(TableName sourceTableName,
                              File targetFile,
                              boolean formatted)
                       throws IOException,
                              JAXBException
        Creates an external HBaseSchemaArchive (HSA) file in XML format* containing the complete schema contents (i.e., the Table, Column Family, ColumnAuditor, and ColumnDefinition metadata) of the specified HBase Table. In effect, this is an XML-formatted serialization of objects of the following classes: MTableDescriptor, MColumnDescriptor, ColumnAuditor, and ColumnDefinition.

        *An HSA file adheres to the XML Schema layout in HBaseSchemaArchive.xsd.xml.
        Parameters:
        sourceTableName - table to exportSchema
        targetFile - target File
        formatted - if true, insert whitespace (linefeeds and hierarchical indentations) between XML elements to produce human-readable XML.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remote or network exception occurs
        JAXBException - if an exception occurs in the context of JAXB processing

      • importSchema

        public void importSchema(boolean includeColumnAuditors,
                         File sourceFile)
                  throws IOException,
                         JAXBException
        Import into HBase the complete contents of an external HBaseSchemaArchive (HSA) XML file*. This process will NOT overlay any existing Namespace and Table structures in HBase. For any Namespace definition in the external file which does NOT correspond to an existing HBase Namespace, a new Namespace will be added to HBase along with any Tables and table components belonging to the Namespace. For any Namespace definition in the external file which corresponds to an existing HBase Namespace, any of its Table and table components will only be added to HBase if the Table does NOT already exist in HBase.

        *An HSA file adheres to the XML Schema layout in HBaseSchemaArchive.xsd.xml.
        Parameters:
        includeColumnAuditors - if true, import ColumnAuditor metadata from the HBaseSchemaArchive file into the ColumnManager repository.
        sourceFile - source file
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remote or network exception occurs
        JAXBException - if an exception occurs in the context of JAXB processing

      • importNamespaceSchema

        public void importNamespaceSchema(boolean includeColumnAuditors,
                                  String namespaceName,
                                  File sourceFile)
                           throws IOException,
                                  JAXBException
        Import into HBase a Namespace and all its component objects as represented in an external HBaseSchemaArchive (HSA) XML file*. This process will NOT overlay any existing Namespace and Table structures in HBase. If the Namespace definition in the external file does NOT correspond to an existing HBase Namespace, a new Namespace will be added to HBase along with any Tables and table components belonging to the Namespace. If the Namespace definition in the external file corresponds to an existing HBase Namespace, any of its Table and table components will only be added to HBase if the Table does NOT already exist in HBase.

        *An HSA file adheres to the XML Schema layout in HBaseSchemaArchive.xsd.xml.
        Parameters:
        includeColumnAuditors - if true, import ColumnAuditor metadata from the HBaseSchemaArchive file into the ColumnManager repository.
        namespaceName - namespace to import.
        sourceFile - source file
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remote or network exception occurs
        JAXBException - if an exception occurs in the context of JAXB processing

      • importTableSchema

        public void importTableSchema(boolean includeColumnAuditors,
                              TableName tableName,
                              File sourceFile)
                       throws IOException,
                              JAXBException
        Import into HBase a Table and all its component objects as represented in an external HBaseSchemaArchive (HSA) XML file*. This process will NOT overlay any existing Namespace and Table structures in HBase. If the Table's parent Namespace does NOT correspond to an existing HBase Namespace, a new Namespace will be added to HBase. The Table and table components will only be added to HBase if the Table does NOT already exist in HBase.

        *An HSA file adheres to the XML Schema layout in HBaseSchemaArchive.xsd.xml.
        Parameters:
        includeColumnAuditors - if true, import ColumnAuditor metadata from the HBaseSchemaArchive file into the ColumnManager repository.
        tableName - Name of table to be imported.
        sourceFile - source file
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remote or network exception occurs
        JAXBException - if an exception occurs in the context of JAXB processing

      • generateHsaFileSummary

        public String generateHsaFileSummary(File sourceFile)
                              throws JAXBException
        Generates a hierarchically-indented, text-based summary report of the contents of an external HBaseSchemaArchive (HSA) XML file*.

        *An HSA file adheres to the XML Schema layout in HBaseSchemaArchive.xsd.xml.
        Parameters:
        sourceFile - source file
        Returns:
        A String containing a summary report suitable for printing/viewing.
        Throws:
        JAXBException - if an exception occurs in the context of JAXB processing

      • exportColumnQualifierViolations

        public void exportColumnQualifierViolations(boolean verbose,
                                            File targetFile,
                                            TableName tableName)
                                     throws IOException
        Generates and outputs a CSV-formatted report of all invalid column qualifiers stored in a Table, as stipulated by the Table's ColumnDefinitions. If no ColumnDefinitions exist for any of the Table's Column Families, the targetFile will be empty. Note that enforcement of the ColumnDefinitions of any of the Table's Column Families need not be enabled in order for this report to be produced.
        Parameters:
        verbose - if true the outputted CSV file will include an entry (identified by the fully-qualified column name and rowId) for each explicit invalid column qualifier that is found; otherwise the report will contain a summary, with one line for each invalid column qualifier found, along with a count of the number of rows which contain that same invalid column qualifier.
        targetFile - file to which the CSV file is to be outputted
        tableName - name of the Table to be reported on
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remote or network exception occurs

      • exportColumnQualifierViolations

        public void exportColumnQualifierViolations(boolean verbose,
                                            File targetFile,
                                            TableName tableName,
                                            byte[] colFamily)
                                     throws IOException
        Generates and outputs a CSV-formatted report of all invalid column qualifiers stored in a Column Family, as stipulated by the Column Family's ColumnDefinitions. If no ColumnDefinitions exist for the Column Family, the targetFile will be empty. Note that the enforcement of the Column Family's ColumnDefinitions need not be enabled in order for this report to be produced.
        Parameters:
        verbose - if true the outputted CSV file will include an entry (identified by the fully-qualified column name and rowId) for each explicit invalid column qualifier that is found; otherwise the report will contain a summary, with one line for each invalid column qualifier found, along with a count of the number of rows which contain that same invalid column qualifier.
        targetFile - file to which the CSV file is to be outputted
        tableName - name of the Table containing the Column Family to be reported on
        colFamily - name of the Column Family to be reported on
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remote or network exception occurs
